content.prompt:
Potatoes as a food crop originated in South America. There are over 4,000 variations of potato grown there. Potatoes were brought to Europe by Spanish colonists in the late 1500s. One variety became the chief crop grown in much of Ireland by the early 1800s. Table 1 summarizes the spread of potatoes as a food crop.

Table 1. Spread of potatoes as food crop from origin in South America

Time Period Location Number of Potato Varieties Grown (approximate)
Pre–1567 South America 4,000
1567–1800 Europe 12
1840–1850 Ireland 1

The Irish Lumper variety of potato was introduced into Ireland in the early 1800s. The Lumper soon became the only variety of potato grown in much of Ireland. The potato blight destroyed most of the Lumper crop between 1845 and 1852 resulting in the death of about 1 million Irish from starvation.

A researcher suggests that the Irish monoculture (growing a single crop) of the Lumper potato did not significantly change the overall resistance of the potato crop in Ireland to diseases. Which of the following observations best refutes this null hypothesis?

choices.label: Before the arrival of the potato blight, there were already two other potato plant diseases in Ireland.
The number of fatalities from the Irish potato famine was greater than the rest of the European countries combined.
During the early nineteenth century, the vast majority of people in Ireland depended on the Lumper potato for food.
Growing more varieties of potatoes increases competition for available resources, which may yield fewer potatoes.

skill.text: 5.D: Use data to evaluate a hypothesis or prediction, including rejecting or failing to reject the null hypothesis.
